intro: Godetia biloba, commonly known as the slender godetia, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces small, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Godetia biloba is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
